title: SQL Fundamentals
description: Master the fundamentals of SQL through hands-on practice. Learn to query, filter, sort, and aggregate data using real-world examples.

metadata.author: Escola de Dados
metadata.authorBio: Escola de Dados is a Brazilian initiative focused on data literacy and empowering people with data skills.
learningObjectives: Write SELECT statements to retrieve data from tables
Count and aggregate data using COUNT, SUM, and GROUP BY
Understand basic SQL syntax and query structure

aggregation.title: Aggregations
aggregation.description: Master COUNT, SUM, and GROUP BY

challenges.title: Select All Customers
challenges.prompt: Write a query to retrieve all columns from the customers table.
challenges.hint: Use SELECT * to get all columns.

challenges.title: Count All Orders
challenges.prompt: Write a query to count the total number of orders.
challenges.solution_sql: SELECT COUNT(*) AS total FROM orders;

tests.name: total_equals_10
tests.sql: SELECT (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM ({{USER_SQL}}) t) = 1 AS ok

challenges.title: Order by Price
challenges.prompt: List all orders sorted by amount in descending order.
challenges.solution_sql: SELECT * FROM orders ORDER BY amount DESC;

tests.name: first_row_has_max_amount
tests.sql: SELECT (SELECT amount FROM ({{USER_SQL}}) t LIMIT 1) = (SELECT MAX(amount) FROM orders) AS ok

challenges.title: Total Spent per Customer
challenges.prompt: Calculate the total amount spent by each customer. Return customer_id and total_spent.
challenges.hint: Use GROUP BY customer_id and SUM(amount).
challenges.solution_sql: SELECT customer_id, SUM(amount) AS total_spent FROM orders GROUP BY customer_id ORDER BY customer_id;

tests.name: has_correct_columns
tests.sql: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT column_name) = 2 AS ok FROM (DESCRIBE ({{USER_SQL}}))
